title: New Releases and More for September 18, 2018
description:
This week, Liberty and Rebecca discuss There There, Stalking God, The Great Believers, and more of their favorite books of 2018 so far.
This episode was sponsored by Google Play, The Real Lolita by Sarah Weinman, and The 7 ½ Deaths of Evelyn Hardcastle by Stuart Turton.
Subscribe to All the Books! using RSS or iTunes and never miss a beat book.
Sign up for the weekly New Books! newsletter for even more new book news.
This content contains affiliate links. When you buy through these links, we may earn an affiliate commission.
For a complete list of books discussed in this episode, visit our website.

Books discussed on the show:
There There by Tommy Orange
Fire Sermon by Jamie Quatro
I Am, I Am, I Am: Seventeen Brushes with Death by Maggie O’Farrell
Stalking God: My Unorthodox Search for Something to Believe In by Anjali Kumar
How To Write an Autobiographical Novel: Essays by Alexander Chee
Buttermilk Graffiti: A Chef’s Journey to Discover America’s New Melting-Pot Cuisine by Edward Lee
The Parking Lot Attendant by Nafkote Tamirat
Florida: Stories by Lauren Groff
All the Names They Used for God by Anjali Sachdeva
Eloquent Rage: A Black Feminist Discovers Her Superpower by Brittney Cooper
Educated: A Memoir by Tara Westover
The Great Believers by Rebecca Makkai
The Which Way Tree by Elizabeth Crook
The Wedding Date by Jasmine Guillory
Front Desk by Kelly Yang
From the Corner of the Oval: A Memoir by Beck Dorey-Stein

What we’re reading:
A Dash of Dragon (The Mystic Cooking Chronicles) by Heidi Lang and Kati Bartkowski
Deep Creek: Finding Hope in the High Country by Pam Houston
Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices
